Welcome to REASTAPI Project’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

main.read_root()¶

The root endpoint.

This function handles the GET request at the root of the application.

Returns:

A welcome message.

Return type:

dict

async main.startup()¶

Initializes the application on startup.

This function is called when the application starts and initializes the rate limiter.

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Creates a new contact for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – The contact data to create.

  • user (User) – The user to create the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session)¶

Deletes a specific contact for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • user (User) – The user to delete the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The deleted contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.get_birthdays(db: Session) → List[ContactResponse]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts who have birthdays within the next week.

Parameters:

db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → ContactResponse¶

Retrieves a specific contact for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The requested contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[ContactResponse]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(query: str, user: User, db: Session) → List[ContactResponse] | None¶

Searches for contacts for a specific user based on a query string.

Parameters:

  • query (str) – The query string to search for.

  • user (User) – The user to search contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the query string.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse] | None

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: Contact, user: User, db: Session)¶

Updates a specific contact for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body (Contact) – The contact data to update.

  • user (User) – The user to update the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated contact.

Return type:

Contact

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

Confirms the email of a specific user.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user to confirm.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

Creates a new user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The user data to create.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The created user.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

Retrieves a user by their email.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The requested user.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

Updates the avatar of a specific user.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user to update the avatar for.

  • url (str) – The new avatar URL.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated user.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

Updates the refresh token of a specific user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user to update the token for.

  • token (str | None) – The new refresh token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Creates a new contact for the current user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – The contact data to create.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current user.

Returns:

The created contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Deletes a specific contact for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current user.

Returns:

The deleted contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.routes.contacts.get_birthdays(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for the current user who have birthdays within the next week.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current user.

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieves a specific contact for the current user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current user.

Returns:

The requested contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for the current user with specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current user.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

async src.routes.contacts.search_contacts(query: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Searches for contacts for the current user based on a query string.

Parameters:

  • query (str) – The query string to search for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The current user.

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the query string.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Parameters:

current_user (User) – The current user.

Returns:

The current user.

Return type:

UserDb

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – The new avatar file.

  • current_user (User) – The current user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Confirms the email of a user.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The token to confirm the email.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A message indicating the email confirmation status.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Logs in a user.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – The user data to log in.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The access and refresh tokens for the logged in user.

Return type:

TokenModel

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Refreshes the access and refresh tokens for a user.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – The HTTP authorization credentials.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The new access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

TokenModel

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Requests an email confirmation for a user.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – The email to request confirmation for.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – The background tasks to run.

  • request (Request) – The request object.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A message indicating the email confirmation request status.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Signs up a new user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The user data to create.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – The background tasks to run.

  • request (Request) – The request object.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The created user and a detail message.

Return type:

UserResponse

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

A class used to handle authentication related operations.

…

Attributes¶

pwd_contextCryptContext

a CryptContext object used for password hashing and verification

SECRET_KEYstr

a secret key used for encoding and decoding JWT tokens

ALGORITHMstr

the algorithm used for encoding and decoding JWT tokens

oauth2_schemeOAuth2PasswordBearer

an OAuth2PasswordBearer object used for handling OAuth2 authentication

rredis.Redis

a Redis object used for caching

Methods¶

verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)

Verifies a password against a hashed password.

get_password_hash(password)

Hashes a password.

create_access_token(data, expires_delta)

Creates an access token.

create_refresh_token(data, expires_delta)

Creates a refresh token.

decode_refresh_token(refresh_token)

Decodes a refresh token.

get_current_user(token, db)

Retrieves the current user based on a token.

create_email_token(data)

Creates an email token.

get_email_from_token(token)

Retrieves an email from a token.

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Creates an access token.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The data to include in the token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – The number of seconds until the token expires.

Returns:

The access token.

Return type:

str

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

Creates an email token.

Parameters:

data (dict) – The data to include in the token.

Returns:

The email token.

Return type:

str

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Creates a refresh token.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The data to include in the token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – The number of seconds until the token expires.

Returns:

The refresh token.

Return type:

str

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

Decodes a refresh token.

Parameters:

refresh_token (str) – The refresh token to decode.

Returns:

The email contained in the token.

Return type:

str

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieves the current user based on a token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The token to decode.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The current user.

Return type:

User

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

Retrieves an email from a token.

Parameters:

token (str) – The token to decode.

Returns:

The email contained in the token.

Return type:

str

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

Hashes a password.

Parameters:

password (str) – The plain text password.

Returns:

The hashed password.

Return type:

str

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

Verifies a password from a hashed password.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – The plain text password.

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password.

Returns:

True if the password is correct, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Sends an email to a user.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – The email address to send the email to.

  • username (str) – The username of the user.

  • host (str) – The host URL.
